text: Hi, i’m looking for some help on the *<https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-php|HubSpot-api-php> sdk*

I have a similiar issue like <@U01CFE2DVFT> above, we want to display the information we know of a logged-in contact on a page shown to them when they’re logged in through Membership. However in `v3` I can only get a contact by `ID` , while we could get a contact by `EMAIL` in `v1` as Lance mentioned.

In Developer Info, I can only see the identifier of a contact as an email. Which would point me in the direction of using `v1` .. However I would like to use the newest available API version.
```"request_contact": {  
    "identifier": "xx@yy.zz", ```
Is it not possible to get contact by email in `v3` in any way?
Instead of raising some specific low level error it raise FATAL error, i can’t catch it. api token error ==> CRASH, duplicate contact ==> CRASH
do i miss something ? , the github don’t talk about error handling

Ugh, just after I posted this I found the `hs_object_id` which correlates to the `ID` of the contact. So I can indeed get the `ID` , for use with `v3` .. However, I’m still curious as to whether it’s possible to use `email` in `v3`.

Thanks, <@U012W4YEUTX> for the reply.

for #2 & #3, I have used the Custom Object Feature for HS. And by using that I can able to fix both points. So now contact is associated with a custom object - _Child._

But now, I want to create *Workflow* based on contact, and in that, I want to use the different child properties.

e.g. Contact A has two children (two items of the custom object associated) A & B and both have DoB like Jan 1, 2016, & Jul 5, 2018.

Now in the workflow, I want all child who has DoB value is after Jan 1, 2015 and send one email to their respected contact with child's information. So, for the above example, both children are satisfying workflow conditions so *it is triggering two emails to the same contact*. So, I want to trigger that mail for only one time with both children's details.
do i really need to code again all the project with dirty curl request ?
Hi all! I need some help with the CRM v3 API... I'm trying to get the deals created after a particular date, along with the associated contacts.
Thanks <@U01D23EQ7DX>
What font / theme are you using in vsCode by the way?
The theme is Night Owl from Sarah Drasner (needed for the ligatures) - <https://github.com/sdras/night-owl-vscode-theme>, and the font is Dank Mono
Nice, I dig it!

Hi Rini,

I think the search API is what you want. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search>

You can search for deal create after a certain date and include the associations. From there you can filter some more.
Does Create Deal v3 support associations or do you need to create and then associate?

Does anyone know how to trigger workflows off form submissions* created via the forms API? I'm passing the hutk token and the page uri values, but in workflows I'm not sure if there is any criteria to say `has filled out X form` AND `page uri was Y` - it only lists HubSpot pages in the page refinement dropdown:
For additional context I'm using a single HubSpot form as an endpoint for multiple forms on my website so I need a way to differentiate the submissions (i.e. contact form versus speak with us form)
Thanks for the help, Neal.

You can't use that as a property, you have to use the assoc APIs

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/associations>

"The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results."

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/companies>

Click endpoints tab. Try a single call of something huge that needs pages

And you will see it

<@U7SL518D6> any luck?

Also this API does not have docs in the new docs site, only the legacy site, should it still be considered legacy given the new endpoint version w/ the security config ability added to it?
`vids` is a legacy name for a contact's ID which appears sometimes
to see the Obj from the deal ID, what Neal says is right... if that did not work I would be hosed as all my code uses it! So I can vouch for it.

Engagements APIs, but not all of the conversation stuff is necessarily viewable from API supposedly, so if you have more detail we can say more

<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/engagements/engagements-overview>

need to see the payload of the 400 using the browser dev tools then you can debug more easily

probably a field name or field type is messed up
<@U01CB6L1RLK> this thread might help with what you asked some days back

Have to use API key or OAuth to authenticate, you can dump contacts out, or hook in with workflow or webhook. I personally prefer dumping out, because then I am bulletproof against Internet outages, but there are rate limits / performance / convenience to consider where the hook could maybe be better
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/integrations/how-do-i-get-my-HubSpot-api-key>

You have to use the old version to do the contact upsert, I use it in production, no old API will be deprecated until the new ones have 100% feature parity.

Unfortunately, IN used to work, but HubSpot decided it was confusing and deleted the support, which a bunch of us complained about, and begged to have it back, but that has not happened yet.

Can you be more clear about the remark "it is not immediately clear to me what all of the parameters accomplish"? I use this API heavily so then I could maybe comment in more detail.
You might find this helpful too depending on the use case

POST
*`/crm/v3/objects/contacts/batch/read`*
API key
OAuth
Test callSet authentication details
Read a batch of contacts by internal ID, or unique property values
Read a list of contacts given a collection of IDs. Use the `properties` request body property to control which properties are returned.

For companies et al, there is no upsert, only contacts, so I use search plus POST / PATCH of the obj ID. This is subject to a TOCTTOU vulnerability:

<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time-of-check_to_time-of-use>

I respond to that vulnerability with :man-shrugging: and :crossed_fingers: and :see_no_evil::hear_no_evil::speak_no_evil:

Not true, search or POST
*`/crm/v3/objects/contacts/batch/read also possible`*


API key
OAuth
Test callSet authentication details
Read a batch of contacts by internal ID, or unique property values
Read a list of contacts given a collection of IDs. Use the `properties` request body property to control which properties are returned.
FFTSAP: Feel Free To Submit A Patch? :wink:
I did write my own in Python so I could have compliance logging in painful detail.
Search, with the associations return enabled
Use the chosen date property and >= / GEQ filter
Then paginate
Note: only 10K per search, might have to use trickery to get all possible records

Create, then Assoc, because you have to have the Deal Obj ID in their backend DB, before the Assoc Create can succeed. Same thing as this concept in PGSQL and other DBs

<http://dbadailystuff.com/deferred-constraints-in-postgresql>

Normally people use >1 form to do it,

But can you just add a hidden var to the form?

Then fill it in with the source using hidden field or your client side code, so you can attribute and filter with that field later

Or recycle one of the "lead source" type submit properties to handle it

I don't have the license for Custom Obj right now, but it can be used for this if you like to, though it's really new and some ppl reported various challenges with it here and there

I have used a Workflow that went across Company and Deal before, and it did work OK crossing up properties from both sides

But I have zero clue what happens when you use Workflow on a Custom Obj, I am not even sure if it's supported or not because the feature is so new. Might have to ask that question to a HubSpotter also

As to how to make the Workflow not trigger twice... set a flag on the contact after first trigger... which is used as an unenrollment condition so it can no longer trigger?

Ooh batch read sounds like it might suit my needs. Regarding search param confusion, there are `filterGroups` but there is also `query` , which was opaque at first glance. Yeah, TOCTOU is a classic but this isn't exactly safety-critical so I'm sure I'll just soldier on.

Thank you kindly for the considerable donation of your time in answering!
